header_summary: Programmers discuss topics including BIP 21 grammar, MuSig and MuSig2 signing algorithms, fidelity bonds, the downside of using MuSig API, and the implementation and purpose of a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism. Suggestions are made to improve BIP 21 grammar, explore alternatives to the "sign-only-once" mechanism, and address limitations of the sidepool implementation.

recent_posts.summary:

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj discusses implementing a sidepool using Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism, including limitations and calculations.
- The number of stages plus one represents transactions for unilateral close and refreshes mechanism.
- Swap parties on sidepool balance channels and can be scheduled every 24 hours.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation involves 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains, ensuring full server blindness.
- In the protocol, both parties generate private and public keys for aggregation.
- Blinding of party 1 allows party 2 to perform key and nonce aggregation.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is limited, but a 5TB hard drive could last 21 years.
- Efforts to optimize data storage by nodes can significantly reduce space requirements.
- Overall, affordable hardware and optimization efforts make blockchain storage sufficient for practical usage.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with a single opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY.
- The new opcode, along with OP_CAT, achieves the full generality of MATT.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The challenge of scaling Lightning in a trust-free manner is discussed.
- Simple covenants and timeout-trees are proposed solutions to improve Lightning's scalability.
- These mechanisms would allow for the creation of channels for millions of casual users.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It suggests using a new type of channel funding transaction with additional spending options.
- The proposal also discusses fraud proofs, saving bandwidth, and alternative options.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository to document his idea.
- His idea involves using a hardware security module to securely send commands to a lightning node.
- Bastien suggests implementing this concept with minimal changes to the lightning node and offers to contribute.
